page.title: 02Local history (2)
page.content: There are many dykes between the fields. At one time Eastoft was a divided village,being partly in Yorkshire and partly in Lincolnshire with the river Don running up the middle of what is now the main road.The church is to the North and because of this is still part of the Sheffield diocese,although the neighbouring villages are in the Lincoln diocese. Each village has a school;Eastoft has about 24 pupils aged from 5 to 11 in a Church of England school while Luddington has 51 pupils,catering for the 5 to 11 year olds from the village and from the neighbouring village of Garthorpe.
